column16: Description of Program
column18: Ave. # of hours of all digital programming per week
column19: Ave. # of hours per week of digital Core Programming per week
column20: Y or N to Q 11 in Digital Core Programming: At least 50% of the Core Programming had not already aired within the previous seven days

column16: Miracle Pets is a one (1) hour live-action program. This show is designed to meet the educational and informational needs of children between the ages of 13 and 16. Each episode explores different short re-enactments of pets/animals doing heroic, extraordinary actions. Children learn postive role models, pro-social values and the importance of taking care of the pets in their lives.

Unbelievable Animal Rescues is a one (1) hour live-action program. This show is designed to meet the educational and informational needs of children between the ages of 13 and 16. Each episode explores different short re-enactments of pets/animals resuing people and other animals from danger. Children learn positive role models, pro-social values, safety and animal protection.

Miracle Pets is a one (1) hour live-action program. This show is designed to meet the educational and informational needs of children between the ages of 13 and 16. Each episode explores different short re-enactments of pets/animals doing heroic, extraordinary actions. Children learn postive role models, pro-social values and the importance of taking care of the pets in their lives.

Miracle Pets is a one (1) hour live-action program. This show is designed to meet the educational and informational needs of children between the ages of 13 and 16. Each episode explores different short re-enactments of pets/animals doing heroic, extraordinary actions. Children learn postive role models, pro-social values and the importance of taking care of the pets in their lives.

In this series, a young adult host - together with Blue, a puppy whose personality and actions mirror those of a preschooler - brings viewers a variety of games, themes and concepts that are based on an age-appropriate educational curriculum. The program follows a narrative format, in which the host elicits contributions from the viewer to answer questions and move the action forward. The program's objectives include encouraging preschoolers to actively explore the world around them, fostering their problem-solving skills and independent reasoning, and creating a foundation of confidence and optimism for future learning. This program is specifically designed to further the educational and informational needs of children, has educating and informing children as a significant purpose, and otherwise meets the definition of Core Programming as specified in the Commission's rules.

In this series seven-year-old Dora and her monkey travel companion Boots invite the audience to join them each week on a journey in which they will have to overcome various obstacles to reach an end goal. The series uses a CD-ROM/on-line adventure game format to encourage a variety of problem-solving strategies. The objectives of this program are to assist children in developing their problem-solving skills, reinforce their emerging cognitive skills, and make computers more familiar to them by introducing and using the conventions and vocabulary of computer games. This program is specifically designed to further the educational and informational needs of children, has educating and informing children as a significant purpose, and otherwise meets the definition of Core Programming as specified in the Commission's rules.

This series revolves around the adventures of nine-year-old Arnold, who lives in his grandparents' boarding house, where he must interact with a group of eccentric boarders, as well as with his friends and other neighborhood children. Arnold uses his creativity, resourcefulness and calm to deal with the issues presented by life as a fourth grader in the big city. The objectives of this series are to help elementary school aged children to acquire better personal and social development skills through life-lessons, themes and stories that will cause them to think, assess, explore and monitor their own behavior, and to introduce them to a variety of people and issues in order to provide them with a springboard for understanding experiences in their own lives. This program is specifically designed to further the educational and informational needs of children, has educating and informing children as a significant purpose, and otherwise meets the definition of Core Programming as specified in the Commission's rules.

This program follows the travels of Eliza Thornberry, whose parents produce nature documentaries and wander the globe in search of exotic places, plants and animals. Eliza has the ability to talk to animals, and her special gift allows her to see and understand the natural world in a very close and personal way. The objectives of the program are to help children learn concepts related to plants, animals and general ecology, and to experience the family interactions of children with parents who are committed to intellectual pursuits and have unique lifestyles. This program is specifically designed to further the educational and informational needs of children, has educating and informing children as a significant purpose, and otherwise meets the definition of Core Programming as specified in the Commission's rules.

This series is about the life of junior high school students as seen through the eyes of Ginger, a sixth grader who attempts to navigate between the worlds of popular and unpopular cliques. Ginger's analytic nature allows her to critique the prevailing social hierarchy, while also understanding the desire to be accepted. The objective of the program is to assist children in analyzing, interpreting and successfully negotiating early individual and group experiences that they may have in their families, schools and communities. This program is specifically designed to further the educational and informational needs of children, has educating and informing children as a significant purpose, and otherwise meets the definition of Core Programming as specified in the Commission's rules.

Pelswick is a smart, mischievous leader of a close group of friends. He is also confined to a wheelchair because of an automobile accident, but refuses to allow this fact to prevent him from being fully integrated into the life of his community or from taking on challenges and risks. Pelswick's advisor and mentor is an irreverent, spiritual figure named Mr. Jimmy, who appears only to Pelswick. The objectives of the program are to teach children that a handicapping condition does not preclude a life full of the same types of successes and disappointments experienced by any other person, and to present to children through the behavior and emotions of the characters some of the social issues they may face. This program is specifically designed to further the educational and informational needs of children, has educating and informing children as a significant purpose, and otherwise meets the definition of Core Programming as specified in the Commission's rules.

This series revolves around the adventures of nine-year-old Arnold, who lives in his grandparents' boarding house, where he must interact with a group of eccentric boarders, as well as with his friends and other neighborhood children. Arnold uses his creativity, resourcefulness and calm to deal with the issues presented by life as a fourth grader in the big city. The objectives of this series are to help elementary school aged children to acquire better personal and social development skills through life-lessons, themes and stories that will cause them to think, assess, explore and monitor their own behavior, and to introduce them to a variety of people and issues in order to provide them with a springboard for understanding experiences in their own lives. This program is specifically designed to further the educational and informational needs of children, has educating and informing children as a significant purpose, and otherwise meets the definition of Core Programming as specified in the Commission's rules.

In "Real Life 101" kid reporters visit real-life jobs and careers and present them in an energetic, informative and educational format. In 1999 a study by the Annenberg Public Policy Center of the University of Pennsylvania found "Real Life 101" to be a highly educational offering for children.
An informative, half-hour series that teaches about wild animals, natural habitats and the environment.

"Teamo Supremo" features three elementary school children who are super heroes. Crandall, Brenda and Hector (a Hispanic boy) possess high-tech tools, which give them extraordinary physical powers. These tools enable them to help the state governor and Chief of Police to restore law and order threatened by villains or criminals. Working as a team, the children use their wits to foil and apprehend evildoers, yet they must still do their homework and finish household chores when a Teamo adventure is done! The series features plots that depict flexible thinking, problem-solving and positive values. This series explore the following: facing fears and self-doubt, standing up for one's beliefs, dealing with peer pressure, relating to authority, dealing with rules/fairness, appreciating differences, maintaining loyalty to family and persevering.

"Disney's Recess" is a collection of stories about six fourth-grade children who attend public school. These children are an ethnically diverse and gender-diverse group. Their experiences at Third Street school deliver messages about problems common to middle childhood: conflicts with authority figures, school and family rules, issues of fairness, peer pressure and coping with disappointment. A number of episodes revolve around class bullies or conflicts with teachers' favored students. Series episodes provide opportunities for parent/child discussions about values.

"Fillmore" is a detective series that takes place in a middle school. The stars of the stories are the members of X Middle School's Safety Patrol, a multi-ethnic group of youth who wear the orange sash and badge of peer authority. They investigate and foil misdeeds in the school setting. Cornelius Fillmore, a boy with a history of disciplinary problems, upon entering X Middle School, is resolved to change his ways. Joining the Safety Patrol, he focuses keen problem-solving skills and physical prowess in the service of order and fairness. His Safety Patrol partner, the brilliant Ingrid Third, also had disciplinary problems while she attended a number of schools. Ingrid and Fillmore work to detect clues about perpetrators of school mischief such as bullying, cheating, theft, graffiti, scams, and prejudicial behavior. Series episodes illustrate developmentally appropriate issues, such as competition and peer pressure, coping with change, improving relationships with teachers and administrators, and dealing with family rules. Within the mystery plots are woven messages about honor, conscience and trust.

"Disney's Recess" is a collection of stories about six fourth-grade children who attend public school. These children are an ethnically diverse and gender-diverse group. Their experiences at Third Street school deliver messages about problems common to middle childhood: conflicts with authority figures, school and family rules, issues of fairness, peer pressure and coping with disappointment. A number of episodes revolve around class bullies or conflicts with teachers' favored students. Series episodes provide opportunities for parent/child discussions about values.

"Lizzie McGuire" is the story of an ingenious twelve-year-old girl who attends an ethnically diverse middle school. Her best friends are Miranda, a feisty Hispanic girl, and a boy named Gordo. Lizzie has a gifted younger brother who is frequently the source of conflict. Their parents handle their children's crises with humor and affection. Stories are realistic, revolving around school issues, rules, peer pressure, the struggle to find a comfortable identity, trust, facing one's mistakes, and the emotional ups-and-downs of pre-adolescence. Particular strengths of this series are its believability and the creation of a live action series that features a strong, positive girl in the lead role.

"The Proud Family" follows the daily activities of fourteen-year-old Penny Proud and her African-American family consisting of parents Trudy Proud (a veterinarian) and Oscar Proud (self-employed businessman), a no-nonsense Grandmother Suga Mama who resides with family, and twin sisters BeBe and CeCe. Penny's friends are Dijonay and Sticky, and the neighboring Boulevardez family, whose daughter, La Cienega, is Penny's rival. Teachers and classmates also populate the stories. The majority of the characters in this children's series are ethnic minorities. Penny faces the struggles of adolescence along with the challenge of balancing academic life (middle school) and home obligations. Series episodes explore issues particularly relevant to 10 to 13 year olds: maintaining social relationships, overcoming self-doubt, standing up for one's beliefs, dealing with peer pressure, relating to authority and rules, assuming responsibility, appreciating differences (gender, race, and generational), maintaining loyalty to family, and cultivating values such as honesty and persistence.
An informative, half-hour series that teaches about wild animals, natural habitats and the environment.
Sports Center 5 Highlights high school football student athletes participating in championship games in a live special.

column7: City Lights: Boston's Holiday Tree Lighting
column16: This live hour-long special featured New England holiday performances including The Black Nativity, Boston Arts Academy and Christmas Revels. In addition, the program aired a story on the Halifax explosion as a historical explanation for the annual gift of the Boston Common tree.
Maestro Keith Lockhart leads the Boston Pops in holiday favorites with guest stars Martina McBride, Take 6 and humorist Jimmy Tingle.

Miracle Pets is a one (1) hour live-action program. This show is designed to meet the educational and informational needs of children between the ages of 13 and 16. Each episode explores different short re-enactments of pets/animals doing heroic, extraordinary actions. Children learn postive role models, pro-social values and the importance of taking care of the pets in their lives.

Each episode explores different short re-enactments of pets/animals resuing people and other animals from danger. Children learn positive role models, pro-social values, safety and animal protection.

Each episode explores different short re-enactments of pets/animals doing heroic, extraordinary actions. Children learn postive role models, pro-social values and the importance of taking care of the pets in their lives.

Miracle Pets is a one (1) hour live-action program. This show is designed to meet the educational and informational needs of children between the ages of 13 and 16. Each episode explores different short re-enactments of pets/animals doing heroic, extraordinary actions. Children learn postive role models, pro-social values and the importance of taking care of the pets in their lives.

Wild Moments is an educational program with the following objectives: (1) To provide a positive learning context for the acquisition of knowledge. (2) To familiarize viewers with the diversity of animal life in the wild. (3) Provides information about the attributes and habitat of different wild animal species. (4) Informs viewers about the dangers and threats of approaching some animals. (5) Increases awareness of the importance of conservation and provide information for enhancing conservation of the environmentand animal diversity. (6) Indicates the ecological importance and contribution ofparticular wild animals. (7) Simulates interest in biological and related scientific fields.The program is regularly scheduled and airs between the hours of 7:00am and 10:00am. The program is 30 minutes in length and is identified as an educational and informational show, targeted to 6-15 year olds, at the beginnig of each broadcast and in listings povided to publishers of program guides.

column7: The Pet Shop with Marc Morrone
column16: An engaging program for teens and their families. The knowledgable content of host Marc Morrone and his wonderful menagerie of animal friends will also capture the attention of younger children. Information is practical, lively and presented at just the right pace. It is an especially nice touch to see that this unscripted program, part neighborly chat and part animal insight, offers unique advice and helful tips on anything from housebreaking a puppy to supplementing a lizard's diet. There is a great amount to learn from animals, particularly the pets that so closely share our lives. This is an intelligent and entertaining program that is fun; the fact that it also gives us answers makes the show very good. The program is 30 minutes in length and is identified as an educational and informational show, targeted to 6-15 year olds, at the beginnig of each broadcast and in listings povided to publishers of program guides.

In every episode, the Stargate Explorers enter another new world. About the only things they can be sure of are that they will encounter life forms and cultures very different from their own, that they will face problems that require functioning smoothly as a team, and that a team is only as strong as the character and abilities of its individual members. At its core, "Stargate-Infinity" explores issues, attitudes, and behaviors important to learning how to get along with others - whether those others are from different races, cultures, and species, or from their own team of trainees. The young explorers serve as models for the young audience. As the cadets learn hard lessons about such things as trying to see the world from the perspective of other cultures, the positive benefits in diversity, or how to mesh their own strengths and abilities with those of others on the team, so too do young viewers. The series examines fundamental issues about how and why to get along with others who may be very different from oneself, and about the kinds of abilities and strength of character necessary to be a good Stargate Explorer - and a good person. The program is regularly scheduled and airs between the hours of 7:00am and 10:00pm. The program is 30 minutes in length, and is identified as an educational and informational show, targeted to 9 to 11 year olds, at the beginning of each broadcast and in listings provided to publishers of program guides.

The series is designed to build problem-solving and informational management skills and to model the pro-social values and behaviors associated with enduring friendships and effective team work. Problem solving themes are illustrated in each episode which also demonstrate fundamental principles of gathering, evaluating, and interpreting information and using it to imagine, present and test plausible scenarios. It is the intent of the series to motivate children to see critical thinking and team problem-solving as exciting, fun and within their capacity. The program is regularly scheduled and airs between the hours of 7:00am and 10:00pm. The program is 30 minutes in length, and is identified as an educational and informational show, targeted to 9 to 11 year olds, at the beginning of each broadcast and in listings provided to publishers of program guides.

NFL "Under the Helmet" showcases the pro-social on and off the field activities of the NFL's leading players and coaches. Working with the National Association for Sports and Physical Education (NASPE), the program (1) educates teens about dedication, hard work, teamwork, goal setting and community service, (2) provices examples of responsible social and personal behavior, (3) demonstrates how to deal constructively with the differences among people, and (4) teaches the benefits of physical activity and fitness. The program is regularly scheduled and airs between the hours of 7:00am and 10:00pm. The program is 30 minutes in length, and is identified as an educational and informational show, targeted to teens (13-16 year olds), at the beginning of each broadcast and in listings provided to publishers of program guides.

Each week Archie and the gang negotiate their way through yet another "weird mystery". They encounter many of the same problems and issues confronting today's pre-teens: how to get along with others; how to build and maintain self-confidence; what kinds of values and behaviors lead to both self-respect and respect from others. Because Archie, Jughead, Betty, Vernica and their classmates are engaging characters with whom young viewers easily identify, they serve as excellent role models. As they deal with such pro-social issues as honesty, perseverance, dependability diversity, self-reliance, and self-respect, their struggules ahd what they finally learn provide young viewers with the kinds of "life lessons" that study after study indicates parents and teachers value. The program is regularly scheduled and airs between the hours of 7:00am and 10:00pm. The program is 30 minutes in length, and is identified as an educational and informational show, targeted to 8 to 11 year olds, at the beginning of each broadcast and in listings provided to publishers of program guides.

Wild Moments is an educational program with the following objectives: (1) To provide a positive learning context for the acquisition of knowledge. (2) To familiarize viewers with the diversity of animal life in the wild. (3) Provides information about the attributes and habitat of different wild animal species. (4) Informs viewers about the dangers and threats of approaching some animals. (5) Increases awareness of the importance of conservation and provide information for enhancing conservation of the environmentand animal diversity. (6) Indicates the ecological importance and contribution ofparticular wild animals. (7) Simulates interest in biological and related scientific fields.The program is regularly scheduled and airs between the hours of 7:00am and 10:00am. The program is 30 minutes in length and is identified as an educational and informational show, targeted to 6-15 year olds, at the beginnig of each broadcast and in listings povided to publishers of program guides.

DISCOVERY KIDS ON NBC TAKES A TRIP TO 225 MILLION B.C. AS IT PRESENTS "PREHISTORIC PLANET," A HALF HOUR SERIES BASED ON THE DISCOVERY CHANNEL'S AWARD-WINNING HIT "WALKING WITH DINOSAURS." THE SERIES FOLLOWS THE STORIES OF DINOSAURS AND PREHISTORIC BEASTS SUCH AS THE TYRANNOSAURUS, DIPLODOCUS AND STEGOSAURUS, AS WELL AS ONE OF THE LARGEST SEA CARNIVORES OF ITS TIME, THE LIOPLEURODON, AND THE ORNITHOCHEIRUS, ONE OF THE BIGGEST FLYING CREATURES EVER KNOWN. THE PROGRAM BLENDS NARRATION, GRAPHICS AND FACTS WITH EXTRAORDINARY COMPUTER ANIMATION. THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS SHOW ARE: TO EXPOSE THE AUDIENCE TO A RE-CREATION OF THE PREHISTORIC WORLD AND EXPLAIN HOW THE ANIMAL KINGDOM MIGHT HAVE LIVED DAY BY DAY; TO EXPOSE LEARNERS TO CONTENT THAT WILL ENABLE THEM TO DIFFERENTIATE AND MATCH SPECIES TO ERAS, HABITAT AND RESPECTIVE BEHAVIOR PATTERNS; TO EXPOSE THE AUDIENCE TO INFORMATION ON HOW AND WHY CERTAIN PREHISTORIC BEASTS WERE THE PRECURSORS OF SPECIES ALIVE TODAY; TO EXPOSE THE AUDIENCE TO BASIC CONCEPTS OF LIFE CYCLE, THE FOOD CHAIN, AND SURVIVAL VERSUS EXTINCTION; AND TO EXPOSE THE AUDIENCE TO INFORMATION ON THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE EARTH'S GEOGRAPHY AND THE RELATIONSHIP OF WEATHER, GEOGRAPHY AND NATURAL EVENTS TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF DIFFERENT ANIMAL SPECIES.

CROCODILE HUNTER STEVE IRWIN AND HIS WIFE, TERRI, TAKE VIEWERS AROUND THE GLOBE TO WRANGLE AND WRESTLE AMAZING ANIMALS. VIEWERS LEARN ABOUT ANIMAL ANATOMY, LIFE CYCLES, AND EATING AND MATING HABITS. THE OBJECTIVES OF THE SHOW ARE TO: EXPOSE THE AUDIENCE TO THE HABITAT, BEHAVIOR PATTERNS AND, IN MOST CASES, DANGERS OF MOST NON-DOMESTICATED ANIMALS; DEMONSTRATE HOW TO BE SAFE AROUND WILD ANIMALS; INFORM THE AUDIENCE ABOUT THE LIFE CYCLE, EATING HABITS AND SOCIAL BEHAVIOR OF DIFFERENT ANIMALS; INFORM THE AUDIENCE ABOUT CONSERVATION ISSUES AND THE RELATIONSHIP AND IMPORTANCE OF DIFFERENT ANIMALS TO SPECIFIC ECOSYSTEMS.

THIS PROGRAM FEATURES THE NEXT GENERATION OF TECHNO-WIZARDS AT THEIR BEST. EACH WEEK TWO TEAMS OF KIDS ACCEPT THE CHALLENGE TO MAKE AN ENGINEERING MARVEL OUT OF A PILE OF JUNK. THEY'VE GOT TOOLS, IDEAS, DRAWINGS, A LITTLE TIME WITH AN ENGINEER, AND SIX HOURS TO BUILD A FUNCTIONAL MACHINE. WHEN TIME RUNS OUT, THE TEAMS COMPETE TO SEE HOW WELL THEIR PROJECTS PERFORM. THE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES ARE TO COMMUNICATE TO THE AUDIENCE HOW TEAMS CAN WORK SUCCESSFULLY UNDER PRESSURE TO CREATE WORKING MACHINES AND TO SHOW HOW BASIC PRINCIPLES OF ENGINEERING ARE ACCESSIBLE TO ANYONE WHO WANTS TO KNOW HOW THINGS WORK.

IN THIS REALITY SERIES MADE JUST FOR KIDS, 20 YOUNG PEOPLE ARE BROUGHT TO AN ISLAND IN THE PACIFIC ON A QUEST TO SUCCEED IN CHALLENGES THAT REQUIRE STRATEGY, AGILITY AND PHYSICAL STRENGTH. THEY HAVE TO FORGE STRONG BONDS WITH STRANGERS, TEST THEIR LOYALTY AND HONESTY, AND DEAL WITH LOSS AND BETRAYAL. EACH OF 10 TWO-PERSON TEAMS AIMS TO MAKE IT THROUGH 12 LEVELS OF COMPETITION TO WIN AN EXOTIC TRAVEL ADVENTURE. THE AUDIENCE WILL BE EXPOSED TO HISTORICAL INFORMATION ABOUT GREAT FEATS OF ENDURANCE, FROM HOUDINI'S ESCAPE ARTISTRY TO SIR EDMUND HILLARY'S ASCENT OF MOUNT EVEREST. OVERALL, THE COMPETITION BALANCES LUCK OR FATE AGAINST PERSONAL EFFORT SO THAT THE CONTESTANTS LEARN TO BALANCE INTELLECT WITH INTUITION IN DEVELOPING THEIR WINNING STRATEGY. NARRATION AND INTERVIEWS TRACE THE EMOTIONAL GROWTH AND INSIGHTS OF THE CONTESTANTS, WITH AN EMPHASIS ON HOW THE EXPERIENCE OF COMPETITION AND TEAMWORK TEACHES BOTH SOCIAL SKILLS AND LIFE SKILLS FOR ACHIEVIING SUCCESS WITH YOUR GOALS.

THIS PROGRAM CHRONICLES A YOUNG AMERICAN GIRL'S COMING-OF-AGE. BORN AND RAISED IN NEW YORK CITY, SCOUT - A TYPICAL HAPPY, 12 YEAR OLD GIRL - SUDDENLY FINDS HERSELF LIVING WITH HER MOM IN A REMOTE AREA IN SOUTH AFRICA. MINUS THE COMFORTS AND CONVENIENCES OF MODERN SOCIETY, SCOUT COMES FACE TO FACE WITH NATURE AND LEARNS VALUABLE LESSONS ABOUT WHAT REALLY MATTERS IN LIFE. SHE LEARNS THE IMPORTANCE OF BEING OPEN TO NEW EXPERIENCES AND BEING WILLING TO TEST HERSELF WITH NEW CHALLENGES. LVING ON A GAME RESERVE, SHE DEVELOPS A GIFT FOR WORKING WITH ANIMALS, AND THROUGH HER NEW FRIENDS, SHE DISCOVERS THE TRUE MEANING OF CULTURAL DIVERSITY. THE OVERARCHING GOAL OF THE SERIES IS FOR THE MAIN CHARACTER TO MODEL A LEARNING PROCESS FOR THE AUDIENCE THAT CHARTS HER SOCIO-EMOTIONAL GROWTH AS SHE ADJUSTS TO A COMPLETELY NEW LIFE. BY THE END OF EACH EPISODE, SCOUT WILL HAVE MOVED FROM ONE LEVEL OF KNOWLEDGE TO A HIGHER LEVEL OF KNOWLEDGE OR INSIGHT. ALSO, AS THE FIRST CHILDREN'S SHOW ACTUALLY FILMED ON LOCATION IN AN AFRICAN ANIMAL RESERVE, THE PROGRAM WILL EXPOSE THE AUDIENCE TO FACTUALLY ACCURATE CONTENT ABOUT THREATS TO THE ENVIRONMENT AND PRESERVING ANIMAL SPEICIES IN THEIR NATURAL HABITATS.

column7: Strange Days at Blake Holsey High
column16: IN THIS PROGRAM JOSIE TRENT, A FEISTY INDEPENDENT-THINKING GIRL, IS SENT TO BLAKE HOLSEY HIGH, AN UNUSUAL PRIVATE SCHOOL WHERE SCIENTIFIC MYSTERIES AND ODDITIES ARE THE RULE. THE NERDY SCIENCE CLUB BECOMES THE IN-CROWD WHEN THEY USE SCIENTIFIC KNOWLEDGE AND THEORIES TO INVESTIGATE THESE STRANGE HAPPENINGS. THE EDUCATIONAL GOAL OF THE PROGRAM IS TO EMBED SCIENTIFIC CONTENT IN A NARRATIVE STORY WITH STRONG SOCIO-EMOTIONAL MESSAGES. IN EACH EPISODE, ONE OF THE MAIN CHARACTERS MODELS A LEARNING PROCESS THAT RELATES TO THEIR SOCIAL COMPETENCE. EACH EPISODE ALSO EXPLORES SCIENCE CONTENT. SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES ARE TO EXPOSE THE AUDIENCE TO CONTENT ABOUT PHYSICAL SCIENCES, SUCH AS BLACK HOLES, VORTEXES, GRAVITY, ELECTRICITY, SATELLITE TRANSMISSIONS AND RADIO FREQUENCIES. THROUGH THE CHARACTERS' EXPERIMENTS THE AUDIENCE IS EXPOSED TO SCIENTIFIC METHOD, HYPOTHESIS TESTING AND ANALYSIS OF DATA.

THIS PROGRAM IS DESCRIBED AS TRULY A ONE OF A KIND VIDEO TRIP THAT PLACES CHILDREN IN ALL DIFFERENT SITUATIONS. THEY RECEIVE AN OVERVIEW OF THE AREAS THEY VISIT AND LEARN SPECIFICS ABOUT THE ENVIRONMENT AND DAY-TO-DAY LIFE. VIEWERS OF THIS PROGRAM HAVE REFERRED TO IT AS A "FIELD TRIP".

City Guys was produced in consultation with an educational consultant, focusing on the learning process of teenagers about the realities of life, and that actions have consequences. The show follows the encounters and problem-solving of five teenagers, and the guiding hand of their understanding but tough Principal, through eventful school years at a Manhattan high school. The cast is ethnically diverse. In each episode the cast starts at one level of knowledge and understanding. By the end of the episode they have moved to another level of understanding and decision making skills. The message is always integral to the plot and present throughout the episode

Baby Looney Toons uses fantasy and fun to provide young viewers with an enticing model for learning, growing and being. A little kid's world is apt to be replete with challenges and conundrums, as well as enjoyment and satisfaction. How does one deal with the possibility of monsters in a darkened room, the adventure of the first day of preschool, the difficulty of finding something to do on a rainy day, or of making a best friend? On an episode by episode basis, Bugs, Daffy, Lola, Tweety, Sylvester and Taz face these challenges and more- each aided by unique strengths and sometimes handicapped by individual weaknesses. In the end, the Baby Looney Tunes usually win out often by means of ingenuity and perseverance, always mixed with ample doses of humor. The educational objectives are to help viewers to gain meaningful life skills and behaviors, such as following directions, being a member of a team, making new friends, and dealing with being sick- intended to better equip them to take on a functional role within their environment. Other educational objectives are to teach viewers to critically assess and value their own capabilities and skills, leading to an appropriate sense of self-esteem, self-confidence and independence; To aid viewers to learn to accept and appreciate the competencies and differences in others, leading to the development of openness, trust, tolerance, and respect; To assist viewers to learn and employ sound critical thinking and problem solving skills in order to better equip them to handle conflicts and manage everyday situations; to encourage viewers to develop positive personal qualities and pro-social behaviors, including honesty, kindness, initiative, earnestness, compassion, cooperation, helpfulness, sharing and leadership and to teach and provide practice to viewers on fundamental knowledge-based learning and skills including the alphabet, numbers, colors, sequences, directions, and elementary science.

Wild America's key educational objective is to familiarize children with the animals of the North American continent, their interaction with other animals and their environment. Throughout the series, emphasis is placed upon protecting endangered species and the impact that humans have while interacting in their environment. Children achieve a greater understanding of nature and specific animal species because of the up-close and detailed photography of the series. Through this understanding, children better relate to the natural environment as it exists in North America and learn to protect its natural species.

New Zoo Revue is a non-violent and enlightening program focusing on ethical, moral, and social issues. It received a four star rating from NEA and the National School Board recognizes it. Each of the 195 episodes develops a variety of ethical, moral, and social issues (i.e. telling the truth, patience, optimism, leadership). These episodes influence the attitude and behavior of young children in a very positive way. We continue to air this show because it is difficult to find an alternative based on consistent delivery of a children’s series together with a positive influence to young children (3-12) as does New Zoo Revue.

In "Real Life 101" kid reporters visit real-life jobs and careers and present them in an energetic, informative and educational format. In 1999 a study by the Annenberg Public Policy Center of the University of Pennsylvania found "Real Life 101" to be a highly educational offering for children.
An informative, half-hour series that teaches about wild animals, natural habitats and the environment.

The stars of the stories are the members of X Middle School's Safety Patrol, a multi-ethnic group of youth who wear the orange sash and badge of peer authority. They investigate and foil misdeeds in the school setting. Cornelius Fillmore, a boy with a history of disciplinary problems, upon entering X Middle School, is resolved to change his ways. Joining the Safety Patrol, he focuses keen problem-solving skills and physical prowess in the service of order and fairness. His Safety Patrol partner, the brilliant Ingrid Third, also had disciplinary problems while she attended a number of schools. Ingrid and Fillmore work to detect clues about perpetrators of school mischief such as bullying, cheating, theft, graffiti, scams, and prejudicial behavior. Series episodes illustrate developmentally appropriate issues, such as competition and peer pressure, coping with change, improving relationships with teachers and administrators, and dealing with family rules. Within the mystery plots are woven messages about honor, conscience and trust.

"Disney's Recess" is a collection of stories about six fourth-grade children who attend public school. These children are an ethnically diverse and gender-diverse group. Their experiences at Third Street school deliver messages about problems common to middle childhood: conflicts with authority figures, school and family rules, issues of fairness, peer pressure and coping with disappointment. A number of episodes revolve around class bullies or conflicts with teachers' favored students. Series episodes provide opportunities for parent/child discussions about values.

"Lizzie McGuire" is the story of an ingenious twelve-year-old girl who attends an ethnically diverse middle school. Her best friends are Miranda, a feisty Hispanic girl, and a boy named Gordo. Lizzie has a gifted younger brother who is frequently the source of conflict. Their parents handle their children's crises with humor and affection. Stories are realistic, revolving around school issues, rules, peer pressure, the struggle to find a comfortable identity, trust, facing one's mistakes, and the emotional ups-and-downs of pre-adolescence. Particular strengths of this series are its believability and the creation of a live action series that features a strong, positive girl in the lead role.

"The Proud Family" follows the daily activities of fourteen-year-old Penny Proud and her African-American family consisting of parents Trudy Proud (a veterinarian) and Oscar Proud (self-employed businessman), a no-nonsense Grandmother Suga Mama who resides with family, and twin sisters BeBe and CeCe. Penny's friends are Dijonay and Sticky, and the neighboring Boulevardez family, whose daughter, La Cienega, is Penny's rival. Teachers and classmates also populate the stories. The majority of the characters in this children's series are ethnic minorities. Penny faces the struggles of adolescence along with the challenge of balancing academic life (middle school) and home obligations. Series episodes explore issues particularly relevant to 10 to 13 year olds: maintaining social relationships, overcoming self-doubt, standing up for one's beliefs, dealing with peer pressure, relating to authority and rules, assuming responsibility, appreciating differences (gender, race, and generational), maintaining loyalty to family, and cultivating values such as honesty and persistence.
An informative, half-hour series that teaches about wild animals, natural habitats and the environment.
Maestro Keith Lockhart leads the Boston Pops in holiday favorites with guest stars Martina McBride, Take 6 and humorist Jimmy Tingle.

THIS IS AN INFORMATIVE SHOW THAT EXPLORES VARIOUS CAREER OPPORTUNITIES AND EXPLAINS JUST WHAT EACH JOB ENTAILS. THE AMOUNT OF TRAINING EACH PROFESSION REQUIRES AS WELL AS JOB RESPONSIBILITIES ARE OUTLINED , GIVING VIEWERS A REALISTIC VIEW OF WHAT IT TAKES TO PURSUE AND SUCCEED AT CERTAIN PROFESSIONS

JACK HANNA TAKES VIEWERS TO VARIOUS COUNTRIES AND LOCALES TO LEARN MORE ABOUT THE ANIMALS THAT INHABIT THE REGION. RESPECT FOR ANIMALS IS TAUGHT AS JACK EXPLAINS THAT ANIMALS, IF TREATED PROPERLY, ARE NOT TO BE FEARED.
THIS SHOW TAKES VIEWERS TO DIFFERENT WILDERNESS DESTINATIONS AND TEACHES ABOUT THE AREA'S FLORA AND FAUNA, ITS NATURAL HISTORY, WILDLIFE, GEOGRAPHY AND HUMAN HISTORY.

THIS PROGRAM CHRONICLES THE ADVENTURES OF TEAMS OF ANIMAL RESCUE PERSONNEL WHO GO ABOUT SAVING ANIMALS IN TROUBLE. THE RESCUERS TAKE EXTREME CARE WHEN HELPING ANIMALS. THE VIEWER LEARNS THAT IF THEY SEE ANIMALS IN TROUBLE, THEY SHOULD CONTACT PROFESSIONALS IMMEDIATELY.

FROM LOCATIONS ALL ACROSS THE COUNTRY, WILD AMERICA BRINGS VIEWERS ALL THE WONDER AND EXCITEMENT OF AMERICA'S NATURAL WILDLIFE HERITAGE. VIEWERS LEARN WHICH ANIMALS ARE NATIVE TO WHICH HABITATS AND ALSO LEARN HOW THE DIFFERENT SPECIES SURVIVE IN NATURE.

Propelled by his own wonderful imagination, Nini takes children on enchanting journeys in Oooberryland, encouraging friendship, learning, cooperation, investigative skills, critical thought, organizing knowledge and a love of reading. Every episode concludes with a problem solved, a friendship strengthened, a giggle and a laugh.

Agua Viva is an entertainment, educational and musical program that tell the adventures of a brother and sister whose toys come to life in Agua Viva. It’s a beautiful place where they not only have fun, but also have an opportunity to play, create and learn together with their friends who help them understand the importance of love, honesty and friendship. As they confront daily problems, they develop good character and a positive attitude towards life.

The enchanting adventures of a set of triplets who embark on adventures, battle villains and discover secrets held in great classics of literature and fairy tales. It teaches the value of friendship, consideration, social themes and ecological themes found in such children’s classics of literature.

Live-action, kid-hosted show with a variety of segments that foster cognitive and social development. Winner of seven international awards, Bizbirije encourages children to create new ideas while having fun engaging in art projects, magic tricks, songs, science experiments and ideas to save the planet.

Nico is a series designed to make children think about the rehabilitation and integration of disabled people in modern society, combining such messages with the adventure which each episode presents. From historical backgrounds to scientific and medical facts, the world of the blind is told in an entertaining, lighthearted way that all children can relate to and teaches children that blind kids are just like any other kid.

Toonimals is a series about animals seen through the amused eyes of animals themselves. Ollie the wise owl and his friends will show you some of the most unusual and least known phenomena of the animal world in a style which is original, modern, colorful and self assured. Strange facts, anecdotes, records, events, stories – it’s the definitive study of animals in a wildly amusing series.

Miracle Pets is a one (1) hour live-action program. This show is designed to meet the educational and informational needs of children between the ages of 13 and 16. Each episode explores different short re-enactments of pets/animals doing heroic, extraordinary actions. Children learn postive role models, pro-social values and the importance of taking care of the pets in their lives.

Unbelievable Animal Rescues is a one (1) hour live-action program. This show is designed to meet the educational and informational needs of children between the ages of 13 and 16. Each episode explores different short re-enactments of pets/animals resuing people and other animals from danger. Children learn positive role models, pro-social values, safety and animal protection.

Miracle Pets is a one (1) hour live-action program. This show is designed to meet the educational and informational needs of children between the ages of 13 and 16. Each episode explores different short re-enactments of pets/animals doing heroic, extraordinary actions. Children learn postive role models, pro-social values and the importance of taking care of the pets in their lives.

Miracle Pets is a one (1) hour live-action program. This show is designed to meet the educational and informational needs of children between the ages of 13 and 16. Each episode explores different short re-enactments of pets/animals doing heroic, extraordinary actions. Children learn postive role models, pro-social values and the importance of taking care of the pets in their lives.

"Disney's Recess" follows the adventures and misadventures of six friends in their school playground as they struggle through the whirlwind of growing up. Issues dealt with include friendship, honesty, and the difference between right and wrong. By dealing with these and other important issues, "Disney's Recess" works to further the child viewer's social and/or emotional needs.

"Disney's Recess" follows the adventures and misadventures of six friends in their school playground as they struggle through the whirlwind of growing up. Issues dealt with include friendship, honesty, and the difference between right and wrong. By dealing with these and other important issues, "Disney's Recess" works to further the child viewer's social and/or emotional needs.

Planeta U is an hour and a half hour program consisting of the one hour academic Plaza Sesamo program and a half hour program, Mimi and Mr. Bob, which talks to children about morals and social values. Plaza Sesamo: Provides reading readiness training, early mathematics skills, education in health, hygiene and nutrition, and provides encouragement and stimulation for academic success. Produced by CTW specifically for a Spanish-language audience. Mimi and Mr. Bob: Mimi lives with her mother and father in a diverse neighborhood and her interactions with her friends illustrate different themes and lessons. Some of the issues discussed in current episodes include resisting peer pressure, recognizing the consequences of your actions, interacting responsibly with the environment, and the importance of friendship.

column7: El Nuevo Mundo de los Gnomos
column16: A significant purpose and key educational objective of this half-hour program is an appreciation for Mother Nature. Through the activities of the Gnomes, children learn to protect endangered species, create and preserve protected areas, and address global threats to the environment.

A significant purpose and key educational objective of this half-hour program is to promote a better understanding of other people. Through the efforts of Anatole, a mouse, and his family, children learn how he tries to understand humans and tries to get humans to understand him. Children can learn to accept, value, and appreciate the competencies and differences in others, leading to the development of openness, trust, and mutual respect, and to value the positive aspects of a strong family unit.

A significant purpose and key educational objective of this half-hour program is to illustrate problem solving and sharing. Ned feeds his pet newt "Zippo Newt Food" and turns it into a five hundred-pound monster called Newton, the most mischievous, gluttonous, and empathetic playmate ever. Newton can camouflage himself to avoid detection, and he is Ned's pal for life. But just when Ned needs giant Newton the most, the newt shrinks down to four inches again. Ned's and Newton's adventures with Ned's parents, friends, and the school bully teach young viewers about responsibility, friendship, sharing, and problem-solving.

A significant purpose and key educational objective of this half-hour program is to teach children about basic lessons about truth, honor, courage, and love through the time honored tales of Greek myths. Through the adventures of these heroes, children not only learn important moral lessons but also learn about an ancient culture.

A significant purpose and key educational objective of this half-hour program is to illustrate the importance of nature and caring for the environment. In the world of the 26th century, dinosaurs roam the earth with humans and classic cars race woolly mammoths. Through the show children learn how humans can learn to live and co-exist peacefully with nature.

In this half-hour show fanciful characters, such as the Old Witch, the Mummy, the Werewolf, and the Vampire, take children on a journey through the outrageous world of the crypt and on the journey introduce a variety of educational subjects and messages.

A significant purpose and key educational objective of this program is to illustrate the importance of family and working together to overcome mistakes. Throughout the shows, the Dumb Bunny family gets into various problems and adventures, but always manage to work together to solve their problems.

A significant purpose and key educational objective of this program is to teach about interacting with cultures other than your own and learning to act independently. When Widget, a friendly extra-terrestrial, is stranded on Earth, he must learn to survive on his own. Throughout the show, Widget’s adventures teach him about keeping an open mind, perseverance, learning from those around him, and taking care of himself.

This children's novella about a teacher and her students focuses on the many issues facing school-aged children. It appeals to the cognitive interests of elementary school children by presenting these issues in the school setting to which viewers of this age can relate, as well as through humorous situations. The program teaches young viewers about sharing, compassion, and tolerance as well as many other pro-social lessons about human relationships between the teacher and her students and among the students themselves. For example, as the episodes unfold, in the beginning the students play practical jokes on their teacher, but over time, the students learn to respect their teacher and view her as a role model. Through many other adventures, the students also teach viewers about love, respect, racial discrimination, and family values.

A significant purpose and key educational objective of this program is to show the importance of determination, hope and love. Chabelita, a six-year-old girl, has experienced a life of loss and difficultly but is still able to persevere and continue on toward her dreams. Throughout the shows, Chabelita demonstrates individuality, problem solving and creativity to overcome the difficulties in her life and find happiness.

A significant purpose and key educational objective of this program is to illustrate how friendship, love and kindness can help overcome life’s adversities. Complices al Rescate (“Friends to the Rescue”) follows the lives of two eleven-year-old girls, Silvana and Mariana, who have both experienced sadness, loss, and injustice in their lives. Throughout the shows, the girls learn to appreciate that happiness is not found in popularity and money, but in true friendship, goodwill toward others and love.

A significant purpose and key educational objective of this program is to show the importance of community and perseverance during trial. Rayito de Luz is a Christmas holiday story of a newborn child abandoned at a seminary and the love and dedication of Father Cervantes to care for the child with help of the entire community.

Zebby's Zoo follows the many adventures of Zebby the talking Zebra and his friends. Zebby's Zoo furthers the educational and informational needs of children ages 2 to 6 by introducing younger children to good values, fitness/health, basic spelling and arithmetic, along with home and neighborhood safety.

Did You Ever Wonder is a natioanlly acclaimed children's series that furthers the educational and informational needs of children ages 8 to 12. Did You Ever Wonder provides answers to the why's and how's on a wide variety of topics such as making chocolate, cereal and paper and how computers are built.

Love To Talk furthers the educational and informational needs of children ages 12 to 16 by focusing on the many problems encountered by young teens and pre-teens. This "Larry King" type television talk show is hosted by Robert Holt of L.O.V.E. (Let Our Violence End), an Arkansas based intervention and prevention organization that has developed a nationwide reputation for reaching out to teens. Love To Talk mediated calls from teens, parents, and educators and includes topics such as teen sex, relationships, drugs and alcohol, teen pregnancy, racism and numerous other topics that directly affects the young people of today.

Kingsley's Meadow is a magical, fun-filled place where with the help of a delightful "older brother" figure in the form of a friendly lion (body puppet) named Kingsley, children are entertained while learning valuable Biblical lessons they will never forget. The children will identify with the antics of Muppet-like puppets Monk, Aaron, Birdtha, and the Petals, a trio of singing flowers. The focal points of each episode are two Bible stories that are narrated by Kingsley and acted out by live-action kids with humor, adventure and a moral that drives the story home.

Becky's Barn is a program that teaches children both education and morality lessons throught a cast of real life and puppet characters whose lives revolve around a farm, specifically Becky's Barn. The show is divided into various segments with a lesson learned through the actions of the barn characters. Segmnents include: the Alphabet Train, the Eggies, interviews with preschoolers, Uncle Henry's Hired Hand (Crafts), etc.

A show devoted to teaching children lessons in moral and emotional issues. The show centers on the owners of a fixit shop and some of the people who live in the neighborhood. Each week a specific issue is raised at the shop and the characters take a special trip to the Sunshine Factory to learn how to resolve situations and deal with problems.

A half hour program devoted to giving kids the opportunity to learn and to worship God. Host Gary Richardson uses songs and Biblical readings to illustrate a moral teaching and challenges children to appply Christian values to every day life situations. Gramma Mac reads stories to children while pages from the book are shown on screen. Upbeat, sing-along songs aimed at children are synchronized to videos featuring nature scenes, children and animals.

Sonshiny Day is a show that has a mix of human and puppet characters. the show features ahost, Audrey, who along with her friends teach morality lessons and Biblical themes through music, song, and prayer.

Just Kids is a program designed to inform children in both educational and spiritual matters through the use of informative and interesting segments. A cast of regular characters share insight that will help children grow in practical ways. Segments include: the Cooking Corner, Weekly Scripure, The Kids Kaleidoscope (a look at different places and occupations), Bible Fact, The Just Kids Singers, and a reading of various children's books.
